intro: Biotia macrophylla var. divaricata, commonly known as the variable broadleaf biotia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The flowers are typically pale yellow to white, arranged in clusters, and have five petals. This variant is native to parts of South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
